gurmukhi: ਭਲੀ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਸੋ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਅੳੁ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਝਾਰੇ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ਭਿਸਤ ਕੋ ਖਾਂ ਹੁਸੈਨੀ ਸਿਧਾਰੇ ॥੫੨॥
transliteration: Bhaloo Bhaant(i) So Astra Au Sastra Jhdare|| Gire Bhist Ko Khaan Housainoo Sidhdare||52||
translation: They carried and struck their weapons very ably. At last Hussain fell down and left for heaven.52.

gurmukhi: ਜਬੈ ਹੁਸੈਨੀ ਜੂਝਿਓ ਭਯੋ ਸੂਰ ਮਨ ਰੋਸੁ ॥
transliteration: Jahai Housainoo Joojhio Bhayo Soor Man Ros(u)||
translation: When Hussain was killed, the warriors were in great fury.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਜਿ ਚਲੇ ਅਵਰੇ ਸਭੈ ੳੁਠਿਓ ਕਟੋਚਨ ਜੋਸੁ ॥੫੩॥
transliteration: Bhaaj(i) Chale Avre Sabhai Outhio Kotochanndjos(u)||53||
translation: All the other fled, but the forces of Katoch felt excited. 53.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਪਿ ਕਟੋਚਿ ਸਬੈ ਮਿਲਿ ਧਾੲੇ ॥ ਹਿੰਮਤਿ ਕਿੰਮਤਿ ਸਹਿਤ ਰਿਸਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Kop(i) Kotoch(i) Sabai Mil(i) Dhaae|| Hinmat(i) Kinmat(i) Sahit Risaae||
translation: All the soldiers of Katoch with great anger together with Himmat and Kimmat.

gurmukhi: ਹਰੀ ਸਿੰਘ ਤਬ ਕੀਯਾ ੳੁਠਾਨਾ ॥ ਚੁਨਿ ਚੁਨਿ ਹਨੇ ਪਖਰੀਯਾ ਜੁਅਾਨਾ ॥੫੪॥
transliteration: Daroo Singh Tab Kooyaa Outhaanaa|| Choun(i) Choun(i) Hane Pakdarooyaa Juaanaa||54||
translation: Then Hari Singh, who came forward, killed many brave horsemen.54

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਕਟੋਚ ਕੋਪੀਅੰ ॥ ਸੰਭਾਰ ਪਾਵ ਰੋਪੀਅੰ ॥
transliteration: Tabai Katoch Kopooan|| Sanbhaar Paav Ropooan||
translation: Then the Raja of Katoch became furious and stood firmly in the field.

gurmukhi: ਸਰੱਕ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਝਾਰਹੀ ॥ ਸੁ ਮਾਰਿ ਮਾਰਿ ੳੁਚਾਰਹੀ ॥੫੫॥
transliteration: Sarakk Sastra Jhaar-hoo|| Su Daar(i) Daar(i) Ouchaar-hoo||55||
translation: He used his weapons unerringly shouting death (for the enemy).55.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦੇਲ ਚੌਪੀਯੰ ਤਬੈ ॥ ਰਿਸਾਤ ਧਾਤ ਭੇ ਸਬੈ ॥
transliteration: Channdel Chaoupooyan Tabai|| Risaat Dhaat Bhe Sabai||
translation: (From the other side) the Raja of Chandel got enraged and attacked all in a body with indignation.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤੇ ਗੲੇ ਸੁ ਮਾਰੀਯੰ ॥ ਬਚੇ ਤਿਤੇ ਸਿਧਾਰੀਯੰ ॥੫੬॥
transliteration: Jite Gad Su Marooyan|| Bache Tite Sidhdarooyan||56||
translation: Those who faced him were killed and those who remained behind, ran away.56.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਤ ਸਵਾਰਨ ਕੇ ਸਹਿਤ ਜੂਝੇ ਸੰਗਤ ਰਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Saat Savaaran Ke Sahit Joojhe Sanad Raae||
translation: (Sangita Singh) died with his seven companions.
